title: 104_hr2631
content: The Act may be cited as the "American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act Amendments of 1995". Administrative authorities of the Office of Special Trustee are outlined in the Act. The American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act of 1994 is amended to give the Office of Special Trustee direct administrative authority over financial trust services for Indian tribes and individuals. The Secretary of the Interior transfers functions and services of the Bureau of Indian Affairs to the Office of Special Trustee for American Indians for administering financial trust services to Indian tribes and individuals. Administrative support services are ensured for fiscal year 1996. In 1996, the Secretary of the Interior ensures that the Bureau of Indian Affairs provides administrative support services for financial trust functions transferred to the Office of Special Trustee for American Indians at a comparable level to fiscal year 1995. If funding for general administrative support services is reduced for fiscal year 1996, the Secretary will determine the level of support services needed. The Bureau of Indian Affairs will provide administrative support services in 1996 at a level comparable to fiscal year 1995, based on available funds for general administrative support services. SEC. 3. OFFICE OF SPECIAL TRUSTEE. The American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act of 1994 is amended to specify a 4-year term for the Special Trustee, with provisions for termination and vacancy. The vacancy for the Special Trustee position shall be filled in the same manner as the original appointment, with the appointed individual serving for the unexpired portion of the term. SEC. 4. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. Section 303 of the American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act of 1994 is amended to change references from the Bureau to the Department and make adjustments to the establishment of certain provisions. Subsection (c) is also modified to replace "Bureau" with "Office" in paragraph (2). In Section 303 of the American Indian Trust Fund Management Reform Act of 1994, references to the Bureau are changed to the Department and adjustments are made to certain provisions. Subsection (c) is also amended to replace "Bureau" with "Office" in paragraph (2) and (3).
